p: Both primary vectors, A. aegypti and A. albopictus, are principally daytime biters. Insect repellant containing N,N-diethyl-m-toluamide (DEET) or another registered active ingredient should be applied on exposed skin ( Table 36.2.1 ). People should be advised to wear long sleeves and pants and have secure screens on windows and doors to keep mosquitoes out. Insecticide-treated bed net use during daytime resting can help prevent mosquito bites. Infected persons should be protected from further mosquito exposure (staying indoors and/or under a mosquito net during the first few days of illness) so that they cannot contribute to the transmission cycle.
